item.title: A young adult book tackles a tough topic: A teen coping with his dad's mental illness
item.description: Saadia Faruqi, author of the popular Yasmin book series, has written a new book, The Strongest Heart, that mirrors her own life — growing up with a father who likely had undiagnosed schizophrenia.

item.title: Sudan's army recapture presidential palace in Khartoum
item.description: Sudan's army has taken control of the presidential palace in Khartoum, in a major turning point during the war. The palace and the capital had been occupied by the Rapid Support Force paramilitary since the start of the war, but over the last year the army have been making gradual gains.

item.title: Families of deported Venezuelans dispute gang claims after deportations under Alien Enemies Act
item.description: NPR talked to the families of four men believed to be in El Salvador. None of them had a serious criminal record in the U.S. Only some had been charged with illegal entry. Three had signed their voluntary departure.
